DataElement.preferredName: FACIT-Dyspnea 10 Item Short Form 5 Past Seven Days Rating Difficulty Washing Dishes Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated rating of the amount of difficulty in the past 7 days they had when washing dishes, using a four-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACIT-Dyspnea 10 Item Short Form Past Week Rating Difficulty Washing Dishes Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week, including today._The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something._Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved._A question about an individual's difficulty washing dishes._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days.

Concepts.definition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Rating Difficulty Washing Dishes Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something.:Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.:A question about an individual's difficulty washing dishes.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
The act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of something.
Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.
A question about an individual's difficulty washing dishes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered Likert scale reference standard consisting of scores ranging from 0 (No difficulty) to 3 (Much difficulty) used with FACIT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with much difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with some difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

Concepts.longName: Can Do With a Little Difficulty
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something without any difficulty.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
